quiz.ques: When the switch statement matches the expression with the given labels, how is the comparison done?
quiz.a: Both the datatype and the result of the expression are compared
quiz.b: only the datatype of the expression is compared
quiz.c: only the value of the expression is compared
quiz.details: Switch performs an ‘===’ based comparison, i.e both the value of the expression and its datatype is compared.

quiz.ques: What keyword is used to check whether a given property is valid or not?
quiz.details: The in keyword is used to check whether the given property is valid or not in Javascript.

quiz.ques: When an operator’s value is NULL, the typeof returned by the unary operator is:
quiz.details: Any NULL value of operator will always return typeof object.

quiz.ques: What does the Javascript “debugger” statement do?
quiz.a: It will debug all the errors in the program at runtime
quiz.b: It acts as a breakpoint in a program
quiz.c: It will debug error in the current statement if any
quiz.details: ‘debugger’ statement is used to setup the breakup points at probable points of error in the code snippet, using the debugger window.

quiz.ques: What is the output of the following code snippet?  ===> print(NaN === NaN)
quiz.details: In Javascript, NaN is not considered to be equal to NaN even after using the strict equality operator.

quiz.ques: What will be the output of the following code snippet? ===> print(typeof(NaN));
quiz.details: NaN in Javascript is defined to be of type number despite its name(not a number).

quiz.ques: What does the ‘toLocateString()’ method do in JS?
quiz.c: Returns a localized string representation of an object
quiz.details: The ‘toLocateString()’ method in JS returns a localized string representation of an object.

quiz.ques: The process in which an object or data structure is translated into a format suitable for transferral over a network, or storage is called?
quiz.details: Object Serialization is the process in which an object or data structure is translated into a format suitable for transferral over a network, or storage.

quiz.ques: Which function is used to serialize an object into a JSON string in Javascript?
quiz.details: The JSON.stringify() function is used to convert a JSON object into string format.

quiz.ques: Which of the following are closures in Javascript?
quiz.details: Every time a function is created in JS, a closure is created. So, all closures are functions and functions have a scope chain that is associated with them.

quiz.ques: Which of the following is not a Javascript framework?
quiz.details: Other than Cassandra, all the other options are Javascript frameworks.

quiz.ques: How to stop an interval timer in Javascript?
quiz.details: clearInterval is used to stop an interval timer in JS.

quiz.ques: How are objects compared when they are checked with the strict equality operator?
quiz.a: The contents of the objects are compared
quiz.details: In Javascript, objects are passed by reference and hence the strict equality operator compares their references.

quiz.ques: Which object in Javascript doesn’t have a prototype?
quiz.c: None of the objects have a prototype
quiz.details: Base objects are the only objects in Javascript that don’t have a prototype.

quiz.ques: Which of the following are not server-side Javascript objects?
quiz.details: All of the above options are not server-side Javascript objects.
